definition: sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation

sentences.english: Nevertheless, the high cliffs and peaks are often shrouded in clouds and mist.
sentences.chinese: 且悬崖峭壁萦绕在云雾之中。

sentences.english: Standing on the cliffs, he gazed at the distant shoreline of France.
sentences.chinese: 站在悬崖峭壁上，他凝视着远处的法国海岸线。

sentences.english: Nearby Mirror Lake offers beautiful reflections of the surrounding cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 附近的镜湖给游客欣赏到水中的悬崖峭壁倒映。

sentences.english: It takes courage and strength to climb up the perpendicular cliff.
sentences.chinese: 攀上这悬崖峭壁需要勇气和力量。

sentences.english: I think they probably call that because it's right here on the cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得之所以这么叫，是因为它在悬崖峭壁上。

sentences.english: For Taoism the most imposing temple is Infinity Temple who was built half way up the steep mountains and has very strange layout.
sentences.chinese: 最雄奇的道教建筑是坐落在悬崖峭壁上无穷观。

definition: sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
